name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Niagara Falls Fallsview Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband made the reservation Aug. 10 to stay the same night. We didn't go with any coupon specials. We stayed for 1 night with supposedly fallsview & jaccuzi. When we checked in, we were told we could upgrade and have a better view for an extra $30. I felt since we didn't book with any specials, we should have been given an upgrade without paying extra. We didn't want to spend the extra $30, and we thought we were already paying for a fallsview room. The room we got was on the 28th floor & the only view we saw was the edge of the falls. My husband & I felt cheated because we paid for a room that included fallsview, NOT edge/side view. We also wanted to see the fireworks. The only fireworks we saw was the reflection off the Oakes hotel. The furniture was old looking/faded. The room smelled. I guess this was why the window was open when we came in. There was no fridge. I can't believe, this is a Hilton hotel with no fridge!! We have always wanted to stay at the Embassy because its location has the best view of the falls. You have to pay an extra $10, total of $30 for parking your vehicle. Better to go to a different hotel & have the option of parking it yourself. We did have a beautiful view of looking at the Oakes hotel. Poor selection of breakfast choices.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: We went for our anniversary & it was a let down but now we know better, we're not returning there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel for a great view of Niagra Falls

reviews.text: Stayed in the Embassy Suites on the Falls with my husband and two children. Great location overlooking the falls. The best thing about this hotel is that it has it's own shuttle that is free if you buy a package. It picks you up in front of the hotel and drops you off at all the popular locations. We got a dining package that gave us free shuttle passes, a managers reception with snacks and drinks, free breakfast every morning and a $40 voucher for use in the Keg Steak House or TGI Fridays, both of which are in the hotel. When we checked in, the front desk girl upgraded our room to a fallsview room for free, which is normally $100 more per night than the cityview room we had booked. The hotel also has a great indoor pool and whirlpool area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.
reviews.title: Best View Of Niagara Falls

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the embassy suites, Niagara Falls, Ontario for 2 days in August 2012 while on vacation. We booked it through Kayak for 1 day and when we got to the room we decided to stay for an extr day. The receptionist at the hotel was kind enough to let us do that but informed that the rate for saturday was going to be higher which was ok. The room was more like a suite and the beds were comfortable. The falls view was spectacular. I could sit all day and watch the falls and with the lights coming on at night it was even better. The hotel was also convenient for walking to the falls, restaurants and other nearby attractions. They also had a bus that would take you to various places. Overall we were very happy with the accomodation and the free hot breakfast on the 9th floor overlooking the falls was the icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Avoid !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed mid week - and there were ALWAYS lines at the elevators. We typically waited 3 - 8 minutes for an elevator. Also, we were suprised that we were REQUIRED to use their valet parking - which was $20-$30 per day. We tried to use their shuttle (which we had to pay for) but because the elevators were so slow, we missed the shuttle. Finally, the happy hour had a one drink limit.
reviews.title: Great view of Niagra Falls!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has received a rate #4 out of over 100 hotel
reviews.title: Good Views of the Falls - Poor Management

reviews.text: accommodations in the Niagara Falls area. Having just
reviews.title: Better Than The Average

reviews.text: stayed at this hotel, we are having difficulty in understanding
reviews.title: Cheap room but everything else was expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: how that has been achieved. This hotel has some real
reviews.title: Great location, Great deal in Winter
Best value ever
reviews.text: management problems. The staff, with a few exceptions,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Embassy Suites Falls View had large well appointed rooms. We had a great view of both falls, and felt it was worth it to pay the extra money. The hotel was very expensive. We've paid less in London and in Paris. But, it was cool to see the fireworks and the lit falls right from our room. I understand that the area doesn't have enough hotel/rooms in the summer - which is why we went in the fall.
reviews.title: Beautiful falls view from the room

reviews.text: The hotel was a long walk from everything. The hotel has a shuttle, but they charge you $10 per person per day, to take it. This shuttle should be free after paying $225 per room, but what can you do? The parking can run you anywhere from $5 to $14 for 2 hours. The parking prices change per time of year, and they are what the market will bear. So, we chuckled when we saw prices scrawled on cardboard posted near the parking areas.
reviews.title: Amazing View/Superb Staff

likes.liked: — The view - we could see from Horseshoe Falls all the way to Rainbow Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The b'fast was quite good, with a nice variety. There are two rooms you can dine in. The 2nd morning, we got to sit in the room with a view. The Manager's reception was a pleasant place to sit and relax with a beverage. (Although we never did see a Manager).
reviews.title: A view that will be tough to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tour Desk is great place to ask questions, even if you aren't going to sign up for a Tour.
reviews.title: Closest to the Falls

likes.disliked: — Cost of some services and food

reviews.text: We arrived mid-evening on a Thursday and stayed through Sunday. We were greated by great service from the valet and bellman. I was traveling from Massachusetts to Canada and it turned out to be about a 10-hour trip with stops. While the two 15-year-old girls napped for half the trip, I was the sole driver and very tired upon our arrival.
reviews.title: not again
Great views.
reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a large conference in September and was impressed with the service I recieved here, especially when the size of the hotel was taken into account. The room I was allocated had superb views of the falls and was specious and clean, albeit slightly dated. Breakfast was served overlooking the falls and consisted of a large hot and cold buffet - staff in the breakfast area were friendly and attentive.

reviews.title: Very Nice Stay But Pricey
reviews.text: In terms of location, my only quibble is that, although the hotel is located within a few hundred metres of the falls you have to either pay for a train which takes you all of 50mtrs or walk a good 15 minutes to get there as the route is blocked. A bit of a revenue generation excercise on the part of the railwy owners I think.

reviews.title: Excellent location, fabulous views, super breakfast.
reviews.text: Spent the weekend with three other couples for a 40th birthday celebration. Room 1605 is a mi ni suite so for 2 people there is plenty of room. Pretty good view of the American falls, not much to see of Horseshoe. While the bed and couch looked a little worn everything was very comfortable. Slept really well, very quiet room. Nice big bathroom with adequate lighting but above bathroom mirror could be much better. Unfortunately the shower stall suffers from water saver head so this is one knock, the other is there are only 12 TV channels. If you visit. self-park in the casino on fifth floor for $5 weekday, $10 weekend. Parking does not allow in/out privileges. Alternatively you can get a players advantage card in the casino. As long as you gamble some you can use this card to get out of the garage for no money. Covered walkway from casino parking all the way into the Hilton. Good hotel to stay at when enjoying Niagara Falls.

reviews.title: Was expecting modern rooms!!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights with family as part of a trip around the USA and Canada and have to say we were really impressed with this hotel. The location is perfect and if you have a falls view room, you won't be disappointed. Our room had a lounge area with sofa bed, a jacuzzi bathroom and seperate toilet and a bedroom with 2 queen size beds. Ideal for the 4 of us. The beds were partricularly comfortable. We went for the magic show package.which included vouchers for the hotel restaurants, breakfast and tickets to the Greg Frewin magic show. The show was good but if you aren't part of the dinner theatre package (which we weren't) you get stuck in terrible seats up the back. We did get moved after complaining however. Breakfast is buffet style. The hotel is very busy and you may need to wait for a few minutes to get seated. The food is plentiful and varied and I can recommend the omelettes. There is also a managers reception, where you get free soft drinks, one free alcoholic drink (although only 2 per room and there were 4 of us) and snacks, which is a nice touch.The staff are all very friendly and attentive. We would certainly recommend this hotel and couldn't find fault with it.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with great view!
reviews.text: We booked 1 night package with diner voucher & Manager's Reception. We whent with friends and coming from Michigan. We were on the 21 floor and the view was gorgeous!! I was very disappointed in the rooms. The furniture the wallpaper have to go!! For the money we paid the room should of been modern and have bright walls and decorations. The breakfast was good and The Keg was excellent!! ( pricier than other Keg but to be expected. You pay for the view which is well worth it!! I found the staff not the friendliest! They need to improve on their manners!! Next visit I am going to try the Niagara Towers the prices are great plus you get the same great view!!! Overall we had a great time!!

Just returned from spending a couple of days at the Embassy Suites. We stayed on the 28th floor with a wonderful view of both falls! Aside from being asked to tip everyone, including the front desk staff, this was a great stay. The complimentary breakfast was huge and had a lot of variety, and who could beat sitting in The Keg with a great view of the sunrise and the Falls!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is amazing, after reading other reviews and comments about other hotels i came to the descion that this was it, i stayed here for one night, although it is pricey the views make up for it, take my word on it, i stayed on the 34floor but then i upgraded due to ppl being a bit noisy, so i was on the 37th, both views were spectacular, guaranteed that no other hotel in niagara has this view, the hotel itself was neat, i was helped right away , everyone was friendly, the keg experience was beautiful, make sure you request a window seat though to get your money worth, it is pricey, it cost about $90 bucks for 2 people, the setting was great tho, overall great experience and reccommend this hotel to anybody, will diffanatly stay here again, oh and bring lots of cash, your going to need it , posted some pictures , enjoy
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL, 5 STAR, AMAZING VIEWS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day we checked in, things seemed to be great.
reviews.title: Great view, horrible staff

likes.liked: — The chipped glass I was served. Not acceptable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, breathtaking view, lots of r&r. Me and my fiance were gung-ho on writing this hotel an excellent review after spending numerous hours trying to find one that best met our needs.
reviews.title: Best views!!
Fallsview lottery
reviews.text: However it was the next morning that things went downhill. The bill arrived at our room and we were charged $13 for internet in our room, and $7 of service charges which were not explained. Breakfast at the hotels restaurant was horrible! There was a long line up to be seated on a Monday morning; this 1/2 hour before their breakfast service was to stop, as per their vouchers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel clerks and valets were the friendliest we've encountered. The view was phenomenal from the 29th floor. I'll cut to the chase and give the pros and cons.
reviews.title: Great service and view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Room was fantastic!

likes.liked: — whirlpool bath, breakfast, managers reception and views from room
likes.disliked: — check in trying to get more money out of you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pricey on weekends (a world poker series was in town) $250 -$300 a night. My wife doesn't feel it's pricey for the quality, view and location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-leave your car at the Casino

likes.disliked: — The waiting for the elevator, but not too bad at all

reviews.text: Room was slighlty on an incline for some reason. Queen mattresses felt springy like a cheaper motel. My wife and I did sleep well though. Valet parking only at $20 a day plus tips accepted. Televisions had front audio/video jacks disabled. Thus disallowing hook up to my camera ( I like to review my photos) or a DVD player. Note other hotels are doing this too. I assume it encourages in-room movie rentals at $13 to $19 a pop. Skimpy but adequate channels. Window opens but poor seal allowed a draft. It was chilly, I had to crank up the heater which worked out ok. TGIF prices were too much. A BLT is about $16! In-room wireless or via TV is pricey. Local calls are $2 each.
reviews.title: Great suite and views

likes.disliked: — not good for people that don't like walking to either the falls themselves or the visitor attractions

reviews.text: Here are the pros:
reviews.title: Embassy Suites excellent

likes.liked: — When we checked in, Hotel staff voluntarily moved us to the top floor of the Hotel yay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night - on a travelzoo offer that included $40 voucher to use at the two hotel restaurants (Keg, TGIs) and full breakfast all for $115! Incredibly cheap, fantastic room - booked city view upgraded to jacuzzi fallsview room without asking. Check in is supposed to be 4pm but as we arrived early we managed to check in at 2pm. Friendly staff, outstanding rooms, fantastic location and an absolute bargain.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this hotel in August 2007. We selected it because one member of our party was not sure if they would be able to tour Niagra Falls and this hotel boasted that all rooms had great views of the Falls. Well, our room had a view of both Falls and it was simply breathtaking!
reviews.title: Loved the view
Nice place but don't guarantee them honouring your booking.
reviews.text: We booked our room overlooking the falls in March for 2 days in October. We were coming from Australia so this would probably be our one and only time there so we wanted it to be perfect. However, when we arrived they told us that we no longer had our room because our credit card number we had given them had been declined. We had put in a credit card number when we had booked in March and they had the audacity to run it to get the money in the morning before we arrived. Now we had changed banks since March so we had a new credit card number and we had travelled all thru the states for 3 weeks previously and noone had questioned the different number because when we arrived they accepted the card we presented or they had contacted us to check. No such courtesy from this hotel.

reviews.title: Amazing Winter Views!
reviews.text: Well, this hotel took it that we had put in a 'fictitious"' card just to secure a room so they cancelled our booking and we were given a room over looking the city. We were really upset especially with the guy at the desk; he was rude and accused us of giving out false details. We complained to the manager and as a result we were given a new room for our second night but no reduced rate for our inconvenience.

reviews.title: stay somewhere else
reviews.text: Breakfast was fantastic I have to say and the complimentary drinks and snacks in the evenings was enjoyable.

reviews.title: Don't count on their honoring your reservations.
reviews.text: Beds were comfy; and bathrooms clean.

reviews.title: Hotel review
reviews.text: Wireless internet was touch and go which considering the price you are paying you would think it would be more efficient.

We spent 4 nights at the Hilton Fallsview Hotel in Niagara Falls in June 2012 and had a pretty good time. This was more of a family trip as we stayed at the Hilton along with my wife's sister and her family. Our room was huge and on an upper floor with a decent view of the American Falls and a great view of the casino across the street (lol). My sister-in-law's room was much smaller and more typical of a hotel room. Our huge room had a king bed and a sitting area with two columns separating the space. I personally thought the room was great and very comfortable. I slept like a champ in the bed. However, the bathroom, while huge in itself with a stand-up shower and a huge soaking jacuzzi tub, had a weird "honeymoon" type feature with sliding accordian doors/windows that opened up to the bed and the rest of the room. It didn't bother me at all, although the sliding window/doors didn't close completely so it was feasible for someone to see you in the bathroom through the cracks. A little unusual but no big deal.
reviews.title: Average Hotel Near The Falls

reviews.text: The first room that they put my sister-in-law's family in was quite old and had a lot of wear with stains and some very worn carpet. It also kind of had that "used to be smoking room" type of essence. Needless to say, my wife went to the desk and requested another room. The desk was always very helpful.
reviews.title: Its the additional perks that make this place!

reviews.text: The hotel distance to the falls was great. We spent a lot of time walking down to the falls, we did the Maid of the Mist boat trip, and took tons of pictures in full tourist style. For adult, we spent some time in the casino across the street. I did ok. I lost $50 on the first day but then rebounded on another night to go up roughly $150 only to drop it all at the roulette table minutes later. Argh! But anyway, one of the great features of the hotel is that there is a walkway that allows hotel guests to crossover to the casino without ever stepping outside, which is great when it's cold or raining.
reviews.title: Five star view and two star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We nenver ate at the hotel but we did order pizza from a local pizza shop. it was pretty good. I know I overrate so it must have been pretty tasty. Actually, I take that back, we did dine one evening at the Macaroni Grill. If you like garlic, this is your place (I don't). I did however have several cocktails at the lobby bar as well as the very large patio bar outside. It was nice to have some drinks and people watch. The block gets very busy, especially on weekends as there are a few bars and clubs across the street in the casino complex.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel and Stay

reviews.text: Also, if you're looking for some beer/wine or hard alcohol, you'll have to walk a few blocks north to the Canadian LCB store on Ferry St. It's worth the walk, they have all sorts of things. Being American, I had never seen a few of the products they had available. We also stopped at a beer store to pickup mojito beer and iced tea beer. Both were interesting to say the least.
reviews.title: Weekend in Niagara

reviews.text: Stayed two nights in a city view, plenty of room,but not furnished to date. Also, not decorated like a four star hotel, expected nicer taste, cleaner look for the embassy.
reviews.title: View is what you are paying for....

reviews.text: Wish i knew about the $5 parking at the casino, i opted for the $20 a day, expensive parking. Oh no free wifi, and cell phone texting service was poor at times. Breakfast -get up early, 730-8 to enjoy a breakfast by the windows, unbelievable view of the falls.
reviews.title: Good views- hotel just okay

reviews.text: Elevator service was poor, waited 30+ for an elevator, took the stairs from the 24th floor, good way to get your morning exercise. Shuttle was a good touch, but there were We Go buses too that take you around the niagara falls area with your passes for attactions. Also short walk to the falls, two blocks over, two blocks down, the rail way infront of the hotel isnt free.
reviews.title: The embassy has the best view of the falls

reviews.text: Tourist information desk gave incorrect information about our adventure passes, buy from table rock center or other main attaction. You can do the package on your own, no need to book a private tour bus.
reviews.title: OK but there are probably better

reviews.text: Other than the view, you might want to opt for the comfort inn across the street or smaller hotel, this hotel was very overwhelmed by the number of tourist staying there. WHILE staying in the niagara falls area, there is at least 16% taxes or even more,very expensive area but so glad the family made the trip to Canada!
reviews.title: Room with a view
Room with a view
reviews.text: When we arrived the shuttle had lost my suitcase, I was crying and my two girls were crying, At check-in the receptionist was extremely helpful, ringing shuttle and police and airport and she eventfully located my suit case for me. Then it was to early to check-in and our room was not ready, she upgraded us to a better room that was ready for us straight away with a view of both falls, spa bath, lounge room. It was beautiful. I would recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Great view!
reviews.text: We had a falls view room on the 33rd floor - amazing view! The suite was as described, very clean,but needed updating. That being said, our stay was wonderful. Everyone at the hotel was courteous and helpful with our needs. We had dinner in The Keg the first night, a table @ the window with an incredible view and great dinner! Perfect start to a long weekend! We used the $20/day parking option ( which meant you were shuttled to your car) the wait was never more than 2-3 min, the driver was friendly and gave us directions to our destination. We only took our car out once in the 4 night stay - shuttle service runs every 30 min from the hotel. We took a wine tour from the hotel, and with that you get a free shuttle pass. Highly recommend the wine tour!

reviews.title: Quite the view!
reviews.text: Took a quick stay in Niagara this past week and was lucky enough to book a room at the Embassy Suites. I managed to get a deal through a local discount website and got a fabulous rate but still, for the room and the view, I would have paid the full rate even without the free coupon for dinner.

reviews.title: Underwhelmed!
reviews.text: When arriving at the hotel, despite the amount of people, I quickly made my way to the attendant who was very vice, cheerful and helpful. In no time we were registered and presented with our keys, coupons for the breakfast, dinner voucher and tickets for drinks at the manager’s reception. I didn’t park at the hotel as I was well aware of the $20/$30 parking options which was more than I wanted to spend. (I parked at the casino just down the street although with the money I lost I could have paid for valet parking... lol).

reviews.title: Goregous Views!!!
reviews.text: I was advised that I was to have a fallsview 2 room with 2 bed room but wow... I had no idea how spacious this room was going to be. Upon entering the room I found myself in the "living room" where there was the front closet, an arm chair, 3-seater couch, a TV (prob 27"-32"... I didn’t measure), and end table and even a full table with 4 chairs. The couch, which was a hideaway bed) was quite comfortable.

This was a two night stay in Niagara Falls...paying approx $300 a night per room. First two rooms were dirty...literally dirty...ball of pubic hair on the floor, dirty kleenexes in the corner, used q tips behind the toilet. The furniture was old and soiled and in dire need of an upgrade.
reviews.title: unbelieveably bad

reviews.text: Moved rooms three times ..the third room was suitable. No one offered to help us move our suitcases and the staff was far from helpful. Asked the valet for assistance in getting a cab and he shrugged and said with distain - I guess you could check with the front desk I don't know. The breakfast was so crowded - we skipped the second morning and opted to pay for breakfast off site. There are far better choices in Niagara Falls.....
reviews.title: Beautiful View

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Embassy Suites. The accomodations were wonderful. Great view, excellent bed, the suite was exceptional. We would definitely stay in this hotel again if we are in the area. We could see both the American Falls and the Horseshoe Falls from our suite. The night view was also very nice.
reviews.title: Well worth the $

reviews.text: Free cook to order breakfast was great. Go at 7am, at 7:15am it starts picking up. Then at 8am, busy, busy, busy! You get two free adult beverages and free snacks per day between 4pm-7pm. Room was always clean and our floor (42nd) was very quiet. The elevator wait was slow at times, but that will happen when there are a lot of rooms. The shuttle is free and takes you to the most popular parts in Niagara. Close to the WeGo bus pick-up spot. I will recommend this hotel to anybody who asks me where to stay in Niagara.
reviews.title: best view ever

reviews.text: We ( family of 5) stayed here for 2 nights. We had a suite at the 34th floor with a whirlpool and a great view on the falls. Breakfast was great but very busy, however we didn't have any problems finding a table but did had to stay in line for the food. Internet was not free and they had only valet parking ( 20/30 dollar a day) which makes the price expensive but the view made it more than worth it. We would definitely book this room again!
reviews.title: Amazing views!

reviews.text: Pros: outstanding view from 32nd floor facing horseshoe and American falls. Since its at the end of the hotel run it gives a beautiful night view as well. Close walk to restaurants and Casino shops. Suite is very spacious and morning cook to orders are top notch. Staff very friendly.
reviews.title: Quite a view - but pricey

reviews.text: Cons: pricey rooms and $20 per day parking which you must take a hotel shuttle to where you are parked between 7am-2pm, valet will fetch afterwards. For $30 per day the valet will fetch your car during those hours. Rooms are clean but dated and it appears the building leans. I noticed it a couple of years ago when I stayed there too. There is a noticeable incline in the upper floor rooms imo. Plumbing hammered in wall after filling tub. To get to the falls there is a $2.50 charge to ride a rail to it and another charge to get back just a few feet. This is not the hotels falt but a tourist trap. Embassy charges $5 pp for your whole stay to shuttle you to the attractions. That's the best bet, getting your car and paying to park on every turn is a hassle and you'll feel pick pocketed. They offer wine tours for $100+ a person. It includes 3 tours in one day. We drove to Peller winery which is fantastic and paid $10 pp for the tour that included 3 tastes and a $5 pp discount on a purchase.
reviews.title: would love to go back

reviews.text: Overall, I went to Niagara twice and stayed at Embassy twice. Would do it again.
reviews.title: Embassy, Niagara Falls Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Embassy Suites and had a wonderful stay. The room was nice and very clean with a view that was absolutely beautiful. Having the little window that you could open and actually hear the roar of the falls was an extra touch! The buffet breakfast was delicious with everything imaginable and very attentive staff. The view from this area was also just gorgeous. Being able to stay right across the street from the falls was very convenient as you were able to visit the falls several times a day with only a short walk. We were lucky to be there on one of the nights when they had the fireworks, it was indescribably beautiful. We would love to return and visit this hotel again!
reviews.title: Fabulous view - but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel with one of the best views of the falls. Stayed here on three ocassions. I have stayed at almost all major hotels in Niagara Falls. Like all Embassy hotels, this is a suite so more space if you have kids, plus 2 comp drinks in the evening and buffet breakfast. Walk to the falls and Casino. 5 mins drive to Marineland. Keg steakhouse in the hotel. Downside is long lines for breakfast and long wait for valet during weekends. Might save you time and money parking at the casino next door.
reviews.title: 20th Floor View of Niagra is stunning
Lovely Weekend
reviews.text: It is a fair walk though from the main strip. Ideal if you want to stay away from the noise of that area. It must be a nightmare in high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: season....
reviews.title: Had a great time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service throughout our stay was good - valet parking (an RV didn't phase them!), check in, concierge etc.
reviews.title: Incredible Views-Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 38th floor (room 3805) We went through 2nd room to the room with the Million $ view. We were amazed to say the least. A perfect view of both the American and Horseshoe falls.
reviews.title: Keep your email paperwork !!!!

likes.disliked: — Front desk unwillingness to resolve room charges.

reviews.text: Our room consisted of 2 queen beds and a whirlpool bath big enough for 2 (we are both tall and there was still plenty of room)
reviews.title: Very Nice Place With A Great View

likes.disliked: — the inconvenience of getting car 10-15 min wait for valet to bring up

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Embassy for a program offered in our area yearly in November. Most of the hotels in Niagara Falls offer insanely discounted rooms for the locals for a few days that month and the money is donated to charity. This year we chose the Embassy Suites because most of the other hotels were sold out, but we quite enjoyed our stay. The hotel is valet only (no daily charge).
reviews.title: The Embassy was perfect for our girls night

likes.liked: — The included services, cleanliness, and spacious rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The employees at the desk seemed quite young and a little on the immature side, but it was not a big deal. Although a little more guest service, like a Welcome, and a thank you, would have been appreciated! :)
reviews.title: Booking again in February

reviews.text: The hotel is huge, usually in large properties the wait for an elevator is ridiculous, but there were plenty and there was no wait at the Embassy. The rooms were clean and spacious.. all of the rooms are two rooms suites. The Fallsview room offered a magnificent view of the falls and city. There was nothing I was left asking for in the room except robes! Other than that it was perfect. The two restaurants onsite were costly, The Keg and T.G.I Fridays, yet the prices in Niagara Falls are always ten-fold because of the tourists. Since prices were similar, The Keg would be a first choice due to the excellent quality of their food. As well, The Keg offered a view of the falls while dining.
reviews.title: great time
Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the rooms. It takes place in The Keg in the a.m. and consists of a large buffet and cook to order station. Considering I expected the included breakfast to be continental, I was quote pleased. In addition, there is a nightly managers reception at which there are complimentary snacks and two alcoholic drinks per room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took a peek at the pool, but did not have time to use. Looked well maintained and was of very good size.
reviews.title: I Do Not See How It Can Get Any Better At Niagara Falls !

likes.disliked: — Mini bar and vending prices. Bring your own soda, booze, etc, there are no stores nearby

description: 42-story hotel located 100 yards from the waters edge in the Fallsview Tourist District, 1 block from Fallsview Casino.
